text:
According to this:

http://www.w3.org/TR/xslt#attribute-sets

It is possible to specify an xsl:use-attribute-sets in an xsl:attribute-set
element. However, if you do that in FOP, it states '"xsl:use-attribute-sets"
attribute is not allowed on the xsl:attribute-set element!'. Am I misreading the
standard?
creator: kamal.bhatt@gmail.com
manuel@apache.org
text:
FOP implements the XSL-FO spec not the XSLT spec. You probably confusing the
XSLT processing stage with the FO processing stage. FOP takes as input a FO
document that is a document conforming to XSL-FO and produces output in the
designated format. Typically the FO document is produced by an XSLT
transformation of an XML input document but this is outside of the FO
processing. I would check if your stylesheet is working correctly with your XML
input, that is producing a valid FO document when processed through your XSLT
processor.
batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
creator: gadams@apache.org
